title: Choosing Fresh Produce at the Market
caption: A family is shopping at a lively produce stall in an outdoor market. Focus: clear description, inference, and TOEFL-style speaking, writing practice.

image.alt: A family shops at a colorful produce stall, reaching toward a container of small yellow citrus fruit.

fullDescription.en: A family is shopping at a lively produce stall in an outdoor market. The father holds a small child while reaching toward a container of small yellow citrus fruit, likely lemons. The mother stands beside them, smiling and holding a bag as they choose items together. The stall displays colorful piles of tomatoes, oranges, and leafy greens, and there are also potatoes and onions in the lower crates. The scene suggests an everyday routine of buying fresh ingredients for home cooking.

intermediateEnglish.en: A family is standing at an outdoor market stall and selecting fresh produce. The father is holding his child and reaching toward a container of small yellow citrus fruit. The mother is smiling and watching closely while they decide what to buy. In front of them, there are tomatoes, oranges, and leafy greens, showing that the market sells many fresh ingredients.

advancedEnglish.en: At a crowded outdoor market, a family carefully selects fresh fruits and vegetables for home cooking. The father holds his child and reaches toward a container of small yellow citrus fruit, while the mother checks the display and keeps a shopping bag ready. Bright tomatoes, oranges, and leafy greens create a colorful scene, and the stacked crates suggest constant restocking and many customers. The child watches closely, which adds a warm family feeling to the routine task. After they decide what to buy, they will probably pay the vendor and continue shopping for the rest of their ingredients.

- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).

scenario.en: 3 people: 1 man, 1 woman, 1 child (family) are at outdoor market / produce stall, right in the middle of a real-life moment. They are shopping; selecting produce; pointing/reaching. A family selects fruits and vegetables at a busy outdoor market stall. There are tomatoes, oranges/mandarins, lemons or small citrus, potatoes around them, and the setting feels cheerful, engaged, curious. Their clothing, like casual sweater, light coat, matches the situation and the environment.

Add place details with prepositions: at, in, on, near.
Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: The family are shopping.
There are tomatoes and oranges/mandarins in outdoor market / produce stall.
The atmosphere feels cheerful.

fa.tense: حال استمراری (am/is/are + فعل ing) برای کارهایی که همین الآن در عکس در حال انجام است.
howToBuild: اول فاعل را انتخاب کن (چه کسی؟): they / the family / the coworkers.
یک کاری که در عکس می‌بینی انتخاب کن و با am/is/are + ing بساز.
جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال shopping هستند.
در outdoor market / produce stall tomatoes و oranges/mandarins دیده می‌شود.
فضا cheerful به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself at outdoor market / produce stall. A family selects fruits and vegetables at a busy outdoor market stall. At first, I noticed tomatoes, oranges/mandarins, lemons or small citrus and the way people were shopping. Then I looked closer: their clothing (casual sweater, light coat) and their expressions made the scene feel cheerful, engaged, curious. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل outdoor market / produce stall بودم. A family selects fruits and vegetables at a busy outdoor market stall. اول tomatoes، oranges/mandarins و lemons or small citrus را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور shopping. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (casual sweater و light coat) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا cheerful، engaged و curious به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the family shopped.
Then, the family checked tomatoes and continued.
Finally, they felt cheerful about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The family shopped.
بعد، The family tomatoes را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه cheerful بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as tomatoes, oranges/mandarins, lemons or small citrus, potatoes are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like selecting produce can signal feelings such as cheerful, engaged, curious. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل tomatoes، oranges/mandarins، lemons or small citrus و potatoes فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل selecting produce چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل cheerful، engaged و curious را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The family have already handled similar situations before.
The family have learned to stay cheerful in outdoor market / produce stall.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The family قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The family یاد گرفته است در outdoor market / produce stall cheerful بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment at outdoor market / produce stall, one small change could create a big problem. If tomatoes, oranges/mandarins had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در outdoor market / produce stall دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر tomatoes و oranges/mandarins نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the family had checked tomatoes earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay cheerful.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The family زودتر tomatoes را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید cheerful بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
